description.narrative: 2.3. By 2021, justice sector policymakers, practitioners and independent human rights institutions have the capacity to fully align the Justice for Children normative framework to international standards and to effectively protect the rights of children in conflict and in contact with the law.

mailing-address.narrative: Rr. Skenderbej Ndertesa Volkswagen kati 3 Tirana Albania

sector.narrative: CRC, CEDAW or CRPD - follow up on concluding observations
Independent national child rights institution / ombudsperson
Justice sector workforce strengthening and capacity building (including police)
Justice, birth registration/CRVS, and alternative care - surveys (e.g. KAP, VACS), data analysis/research/evaluation evidence generation, synthesis, and use
Promoting diversion and alternatives to deprivation of liberty

Justice, Law and Order policy, planning and administration

UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 2.3. By 2021, justice sector policymakers, practitioners and independent human rights institutions have the capacity to fully align the Justice for Children normative framework to international standards and to effectively protect the rights of children in conflict and in contact with the law.

description.narrative: Albania further improved the normative framework on justice for children in 2019, providing legal guarantees for the right of the child to be heard in legal processes affecting them. Justice system institutions stepped up implementation efforts at the central and local level. Human rights institutions capacities to advance protection of child rights further strengthened. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:09/01/2020

title.narrative: Existence of procedures and services for children in contact with law that are applied and delivered in line with international norms

baseline.value: Score 2 (insufficient) - The right of the child to be heard/participate in criminal, civil, and administrative processes is recognised only by the Family Code

target.value: 2021:Score 3 (Fair) - Criminal Justice Legislation recognises the right of the child to be heard
